intro: Sedum japonicola, commonly known as Japanese stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to Japan. It features fleshy, upright stems and small, green to reddish leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces clusters of star-shaped, yellow flowers during the summer months. It is well adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, making it a hardy species for gardens. Sedum japonicola is often used in rock gardens and as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
